alert.note: Alert for Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 1:47PM CST until March 05 at 3:31AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Arkansas... Fourche LaFave River Near Gravelly affecting Yell County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fourche LaFave River Near Gravelly. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Portions of Highway 28 effected. Timber and pasture along West Bank floods. Property and livestock should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM CST Friday the stage was 28.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting just over 28 feet and will fall to below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 4.4 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 12 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Crest Time Date Fourche Lafave R Gravelly 24.0 28.5 Fri 12 PM 12.1 7.4 5.8 *Cresting* &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
